intro: Saurauia intermedia var. granulosa, commonly known as the granular saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically in mountainous regions. The varietal name "granulosa" refers to the granular texture of its bark and leaves.
